title: The Tyranny of the Marginal User
dot: digraph{subgraph cluster_0{label="OKCupid";"Past (Long Essays, Many Questions, Match Scores)"->"Present (Tinder Clone, Swipe Left/Right)";}subgraph cluster_1{label="Software in General";"Past (Good Features, User Agency)"->"Present (Minimal User Agency, Infinite Scrolling, Garbage Content)";"Reddit/Craigslist (Frozen in Time, Useful)"->"Other Software (Decayed)";}subgraph cluster_2{label="Cause: Tyranny of the Marginal User";"Company Goals (Gain More Users, Monetize)"->"North Star Metric (DAUs)";"DAUs Focus"->"Cater to Marginal User";"Marginal User (Marl) Characteristics"->"App Design Decisions";}subgraph cluster_3{label="Marginal User (Marl)";"Low Attention Span"->"Needs Immediate Stimulation";"Zero UI Complexity Tolerance"->"Simple, Repetitive Actions";"No Interest in Settings"->"No Customization";}subgraph cluster_4{label="Consequences";"Cater to Marl"->"Good Tools for Creativity/Agency Suffer";"Good Tools (Built by Hobbyists, Used by Few)"->"Acquired and Killed by Marl - Serving Companies";}"OKCupid: Present"->"Software in General: Present";"Software in General: Present"->"Cause: Tyranny of the Marginal User";"Cause: Tyranny of the Marginal User"->"Marginal User (Marl)";"Marginal User (Marl)"->"Consequences";}

title: PostgreSQL 16
dot:
digraph postgres_release{node[shape=rect, style=filled, fillcolor="#f2f2f2", fontname="Arial", fontsize=10];title[label="PostgreSQL 16 Release - Key Highlights", shape=ellipse, style=bold, fillcolor="#0099CC", fontcolor="white", fontsize=14];performance[label="Performance Improvements
 - Parallel Query Optimization
 - Bulk Loading Improvements
 - SIMD CPU Acceleration", shape=box, fillcolor="#b3e0ff"];logical_replication[label="Logical Replication
 - Standby Instance Replication
 - Parallel Workers for Subscribers
 - Bidirectional Replication", shape=box, fillcolor="#b3e0ff"];developer_experience[label="Developer Experience
 - SQL/JSON Syntax Enhancements
 - New psql Commands
 - Text Collations with ICU Support", shape=box, fillcolor="#b3e0ff"];monitoring[label="Monitoring
 - New pg_stat_io View
 - Auto-Explain Improvements
 - Enhanced Query Tracking", shape=box, fillcolor="#b3e0ff"];access_control_security[label="Access Control & Security
 - pg_hba.conf Enhancements
 - SSL and Kerberos Security Improvements
 - Security-Oriented Client Connection Parameters", shape=box, fillcolor="#b3e0ff"];title->performance;title->logical_replication;title->developer_experience;title->monitoring;title->access_control_security;external_links[label="External Links
 - Release Notes
 - Download PostgreSQL
 - Press Kit
 - Security Page
 - Follow @postgresql", shape=box, style=dashed, fillcolor="#e6f2ff"];title->external_links;rankdir=LR;fontname="Arial";fontsize=10;ranksep=1;}

title: How mobile apps illegally share personal data

title: Chromebooks will get 10 years of automatic updates
dot: digraph ChromebookFeatures{rankdir=TB;subgraph cluster_main{label="Chromebook Features";subgraph cluster_updates{label="10 Years of Automatic Updates";security[label="Security Priority"];update_frequency[label="Automatic Updates Every 4 Weeks"];extended_updates[label="Extended to 10 Years (2024 for 2021 onwards)"];compatibility[label="Work with Component Manufacturers"];post_update_security[label="Built - in Security (e.g. Verified Boot)"];security->update_frequency->extended_updates->compatibility->post_update_security;}subgraph cluster_repair{label="Quicker Repair Processes";in_school_repair[label="In - School Repair Programs (80% US Schools)"];chromebook_repair_program[label="Chromebook Repair Program"];new_repair_flows[label="New Repair Flows (No USB Key)"];time_reduction[label="Reduce Software Repair Time by 50%"];in_school_repair->chromebook_repair_program->new_repair_flows->time_reduction;}subgraph cluster_sustainability{label="More Energy - Efficient & Sustainably Manufactured";energy_efficient_features[label="New Energy - Efficient Features"];adaptive_charging[label="Adaptive Charging"];battery_saver[label="Battery Saver"];sustainable_manufacturing[label="Sustainable Manufacturing (PCR, etc.)"];energy_efficient_features->adaptive_charging->battery_saver;energy_efficient_features->sustainable_manufacturing;}subgraph cluster_recycling{label="Recyclable Devices";reseller_recycling[label="Reseller Recycling (Schools)"];drop_off_locations[label="Google Maps Drop - Off Locations"];reseller_recycling->drop_off_locations;}subgraph cluster_cost{label="Lowest Ownership Costs";lower_upfront_costs[label="Lower Upfront Costs"];lower_operation_costs[label="Lower Operation Costs"];ransomware_protection[label="No Reported Ransomware Attacks"];lower_upfront_costs->lower_operation_costs->ransomware_protection;}}}

title: Calif. passes strongest right-to-repair bill yet, requiring 7 years of parts

title: Xfce Wayland Development Roadmap
dot:
digraph XfceWayland{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];overall_plans[label="Overall Plans
For Xfce 4.20, add preliminary Wayland support to core components
while keeping X11 support"];long_term_goals[label="Long Term Goals
Unclear which release will target complete Wayland transition"];agreed_guidelines[label="Agreed Guidelines
- No XWayland dependency
- Use wlroots over libmutter
